result.execSummary:
The defendant Jamal C Cocroft was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - County Ordinance. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid $50.00 per month starting 7-1-2016 and each month thereafter or penalty of 4 days jail for non-payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Jamal C Cocroft in court with attorney Tedia K. Gamino by Atty. Graber.  

State moves to amend Count 2 to a County Ordinance of DC.
Defense has no objections.

Defendant enters a No Contest plea to the amended charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the amended charge.
Count 1 is dismissed to a read in.

Court orders the following:
Fine:  $267.50
To be paid at the rate of $50 per month, starting  07/01/16 and the 1st of every month until paid in full.
Alternate:  4 Days in the Waukesha County Jail.

Defendant to have no VIOLENT contact with victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint or her residence.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

Defendant Jamal C Cocroft in court with attorney Kathryn Graber for Tedia K. Gamino.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Graber makes statements regarding her bail modification motion.  Court grants the request for no VIOLENT contact with the victim.  Hearing scheduled for May 31, 2016 at 09:00 am.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Jamal C Cocroft in court with attorney Tedia K. Gamino by Atty. Graber.  
Defense received discovery and an offer in court.
File not called on the record.
  Hearing scheduled for May 19, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Jamal C Cocroft in court.  

Defendant does qualify for Public Defender representative, however, they were unable to get someone here for today's court date.
File not called on the record.
  Hearing scheduled for April 13, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Jamal C Cocroft in court. 

Defendant referred to the Public Defender's Office.  Hearing scheduled for March 9, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint or her residence.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

Defendant Jamal C Cocroft in court, in custody.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morin indicates the defendant was not interviewed.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 10:00 am.
